content.description: Thin moves with difficult footwork climb on nice varnish on lower section. If you are tall you will have an easier time and i will hate you. Short slab leads to fantastic roof that is more fun than difficult. Consistent 10d-ish climbing to the top.
content.location: First climb on the far north end of wall. To climber's left of Day Out with the Lads.

content.description: To the right of a bolted slab and a chossy OW corner, there is a vertical face with a broken seam and a line of bolts. This appears to be an unfinished project, though maybe it has been done.
content.location: Between Atman and Petrificado, which entails a distance of 100 yards or so, there is a corner above the trail a little with a bolted slab (5.7) on the left and a vertical bolted face (project) on the right.

content.description: Follow a right leaning crack to a ledge and then up ledges with friable ledges to a 2-bolt anchor inches below the summit.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of The Emptiness and Running to a Standstill, on the south/southwest facing aspect of this feature. Walk slightly off the trail up a small steep eroded gully to the base of the climb in a large dihedral/corner.

content.description: Sunkist ascends a striking arete at the northern end of the Zen Wall. Belay either from the ground directly below the arete or a two-bolt anchor at the base of the climb. Â To reach the base of the climb, scramble past loose boulders on the right side and then traverse back left on large ledge. Clip an anchor bolt and your first lead bolt from a stance, take a deep breath, and launch up the face. This is a well-protected and super rad rock climb. The anchor is equipped with Metolius rap rings.
Huecos up to bulge, then some reachy crimps to anchors
content.location: 100 meters to the north of Re-bar ladder in a dark brown huecoed wall facing west

content.description: Steep slab on varnish edges
content.location: 100 meters south of Atman, in a south facing corner.

content.description: Climb the slab, stemming off the wall to the right and usng the crack for hands for a few bolts and then move left for the final 2 bolts to the 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Between Atman and Petrificado, which entails a distance of 100 yards or so, there is a corner above the trail a little with a bolted slab (5.7) on the left and a vertical bolted face (project) on the right.

content.description: Nice Pockets and edges past seven bolts up face just left of One Hand Clapping.
content.location: Just south of fourth class ledge access. right next to One Hand Clapping

content.description:
If you enjoy 5.10 gear lines, this is the route for you. Samsara climbs a steep crack which grows from fingers, thin hands, hands, fists, and finally off-fists. The starting hand crack is protected by a couple bolts, which leads to the crux off-fingers crack in the overhanging wall. The final crux is in the fist sized finish to the anchors. A few key face holds keeps this at the 5.10 level. (barely)

A must do trad line!!!
content.location: Climbs the obvious crack to the left of Now and Zen

content.description: Jam obvious fist crack through a small roof.  A little loos in the middle.
content.location: Far south end of wall past fixed ladder

content.description: climbs a flake that goes up a varnished wall through the crux then through some nice crimpers up to the chains.
content.protection: 8 bolts and shared 2-bolt anchor with The Emptiness

content.description: Pure mind climbs a well protected but heady sandstone slab with small varnished edges. There is no real crux but the climbing is sustained. The anchors are visible from the cliff edge and make for a easy rap into the wall.
content.location: Located about half way down the cliff on a varnished slab

content.description: Junky start to an awesome splitter.

Start in a 15ft right facing dihedral with an obvious fist-wide crack with an unobvious finger crack inches to the right. From the ledge go up another 20ft through a loose conglomerate band. Then go up the 3rd crack through a brown face. Finish on the small left-facing hand crack on the left side of a large flake-type feature. Two bolted anchors are found at the top of the hand crack.
content.protection: Single rack of cams from blue TCU up to #2 or #3 Camelot. Each crack is a different size.
content.location: Down the hill to the right of One Hand Clapping, there is a nice flat sandy spot with a tiered section of rock that has some obvious splitter cracks in orange rock.

content.description: Good technical route that begins on top of a boulder. Begin on small incuts through the first 3 bolts to good rest. Climb to top through steep section on cool pockets. DO IT !
content.location: zen wall

content.description: Offwidth, offwidth, offwidth, grab your flannel, hightops, fat cams, and get after this stellar inverted roof problem.
content.protection: Hand sized pieces will get you to the roof, from there we used one #5 and three #6's (BD or Wild Country), and one purple Big Bro at the lip of the roof to avoid pulling your cams into the roof. Two bolts with rap rings are at the finish.
content.location: Look for the large offwidth roof at the north (left) end of the wall. The easiest approach is to traverse the wall from the north side. Shortly after the boulder garden there is an easy walk down below the cliffs. Follow the cliff band as it gets taller for about 10 minutes and you should see it.

content.description: Devious face of small edges and varnish crimps
content.location: 100 meters south of Atman on a west facing wall to the right of a corner slab

content.description: This thing is pretty sweet!   A nice techy arete.  Start on the right side, connects with the left side at about half way, then back up the right side for the finish.  Very nice movement on thin holds.
content.location: Best approached from the 4th class descent with ropes.   Upon reaching the base of the cliff, One Hand Clapping, 12a is in plain view and just to the south.   Head north along the cliff line.   Look for a brown arete just above the trail.   The  arete is to the right of a chimney/corridor.

content.description: Off Balance moves through a bulge lead to nice varnished crimping. Eight Bolts plus anchor
content.location: Far south end of wall, past the fixed ladder, just left of Sacred Cows crack.

content.description: In the Moment climbs a vanished wall with good edges with a crux lieback or reach move mid way.  There are good handholds to clip bolts after each hard move.
content.location: The right route on the varnished wall to the left of Chop Wood Carry Wood

content.description: AWESOME LONG ROUTE. Begin climbing sweet arete with large (chipped?) pocket near the 2nd bolt. Crimps, jugs, and sloping ledges lead to crux getting to last bolt. Long and good. Prob. no chalk but DO IT !
content.location: zen wall

content.description: nice slab climb through crimps side pulls and edges. crux is about halfway into it.

A cool route that makes a nice warm up.   Start in a corner and follow a crack system onto the face.   climb the face to reach a small overhang.   Clip the  bolt and pull the overhang (crux)....and coolest part of the climb.   Be careful of what you grab above the roof, there are several awesome holds that are about to rip out.
content.location: Descend via the ladders.   Head north along the cliff.   This is one of the first routes that you will see.

content.description: To the left of Stinger at the Tail, Huecos to edges through a bulge.
content.location: Just left of Stinger at the Tail

content.description: Beautiful line. This awesome route climbs over a very powerful and sequential V6-ish roof to some slopey-pinches Â on the arete. Then continue up the left side of the arete for much easier and interesting climbing, probably in the 5.11a range. Suggestion: Clip the first bolt by hand from the top of the boulder and stick-clip the second. Clipping the second bolt will likely be too difficult for someone who is challenged at this grade; and the fall from pulling over the bulge and not clipping the 2nd bolt is a grounder onto the boulder below.Â  In the Goss guidebook, this is rated 5.11d. Not even close.
content.location: Go down the ladder and this is to the left, or if looking at the cliff, or at the ladders, this route is down to the right, just around the corner.

content.description: This climb gives a little bit of everything. Blocky and geometric climbing and a side of friction at the bottom lead to flakes and even a nice hand jam and some finger constrictions later. Some questionable rock, but very well bolted.
content.location: Far north end of wall to climber's right of Yield and Overcome. Just around corner from 4th class ledge.

content.description: The climb starts in a shady alcove. Climb a loose start up to an arete. A juggy varnished wall leads to the anchor.  Some of the plates are hollow so pull lightly. A fun steep moderate...
content.location: Located on a well varnished wall just to the left of the large roof on Black Rain

content.description: a very fun climb! its a bolted crack which was bolted because it is to small to protect. really fun though. starts with some nice ledges and a side pull goes up over a hump onto a slab and then a hand free rest up to some technical climbing of crux and good rest and crux and good rest. with the crux's getting harder after every rest clear up until you clip the chains. fun moves up the whole thing with a couple finger jams where the crack widens slightly and one or two nice spots for a foot jam.
content.location: to the right of the chimney access

content.description: A nice slab climb with positive edges.   The occasional white limestone like patina makes some of the moves possible.   Fun moves.  The harder moves are near the bolts.
content.location: The easiest way to reach this climb is the chimney access point.   It's directly at the bottom of the chimney and just to the right of Tabula Rasa, 11b.

content.description: The initial 20 feet of varnished arete climbing is the main appeal here, with difficulties that start as soon as you leave the ground. Get on the ledge above the arete and cruise the easy face up to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts. The 3rd clip is a tad sporty but not too serious.
content.location: 4th bolted route heading north from the ladder. First sport route right of One Hand Clapping.
